CheckTitle: WAF is enabled to protect against web application attacks
Description: Verifies that the Web Application Firewall (WAF) is enabled to protect against common web vulnerabilities including SQL injection, XSS, and OWASP Top 10 threats.
Risk: Without WAF, web applications are exposed to common attack vectors including SQL injection, cross-site scripting, and other exploitation techniques that can lead to data breaches or system compromise.

Recommendation.Text: Enable WAF as a critical layer of defense for web applications. Configure managed rulesets and create custom rules based on your application's specific threat model and traffic patterns.

Notes: WAF is available on Pro, Business, and Enterprise plans.
